# Scale: Harmonic in B (Mode: Ionian augmented, Shape: C)

## Brief Description
The Harmonic scale in B, also known as the Ionian augmented mode, features a unique and exotic sound that can add color and tension to your musical compositions. By introducing an augmented 2nd interval between the 2nd and 3rd notes (C# and D#), this scale adds a distinct flavor to your music that can evoke various emotions and moods.

## Notes and Intervals
- B (Root)
- C
- D#
- E
- F#
- G
- A#

This scale is defined by the following intervals:
- Root to major 2nd (C): Whole tone
- Major 2nd to augmented 3rd (D#): Augmented 2nd
- Augmented 3rd to perfect 4th (E): Half tone
- Perfect 4th to perfect 5th (F#): Whole tone
- Perfect 5th to major 6th (G): Whole tone
- Major 6th to major 7th (A#): Whole tone
- Major 7th to root (B): Half tone

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Harmonic scale in B, with its augmented intervals, is often used in genres that require a touch of mystery and exoticism. It can be found in various styles such as World Music, Jazz Fusion, and certain types of Progressive Rock. This scale can create a sense of tension and drama in your music, making it perfect for building suspenseful or emotional musical passages.

3. "The Dance of Eternity" by Dream Theater - This progressive rock track showcases the versatility of the Harmonic scale in building complex and dynamic musical landscapes.
